subclassFeature.name: Sniper
entries: Snipers are the apex of marksmanship, able to reliably make incredibly hard and precisely targeted shots from great distance, given the time to take aim from a safe spot. Meeting these conditions means that snipers have to train in hit and run tactics, to be masters of stealth and to develop the ability to instantly grasp the state and shape of the battlefield, making them excellent tacticians.

Their privileged position in battle also means they have a more comprehensive and global point of view of the battlefield, so snipers often cover the role of coordinating the actions of their allies from afar.

subclassFeature.name: Sniping Tactics
entries: You are trained in a number of tactics to make the most out of your role in combat. Your ability to execute them is represented by your Tactics dice, which are each a d6. You have a number of these dice equal to twice your proficiency bonus, and they fuel the various tactics you know, which are detailed below.

Some of your tactics expend the Tactics die they use, as specified in a tactic's description, and you can't use a tactic if it requires you to use a die when your dice are all expended. You regain all your expended Tactics dice when you finish a long rest. In addition, as a bonus action, you can regain one expended Tactics die, but you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach certain levels in this class, the size of your Tactics dice increases: at 5th level (d8), 11th level (d10), and 17th level (d12).
The tactics below use your Tactics dice.

entries.name: Coordinator
entries: You know how to build small communication devices that you distribute among your allies. You can establish a remote, verbal communication between yourself and others—perfect for quiet infiltration. As an action, choose one or more creatures within 10 ft. of you, up to a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus, and then roll one Tactics die. For a number of hours equal to the number rolled, the chosen creatures can speak remotely with you, and you can speak remotely with them.

To send or receive a message (no action required), you and the other creature must be within 1 mile of each other. A creature can't use this way of communicating if it can't speak/hear or if it can't speak any languages, and a creature can end the connection at any time (no action required). You and the creature need to speak a common language to understand each other. The first time you use this power after each long rest, you don't expend the Tactics die. All other times you use the power, you expend the die.

entries.name: Hidden Menace
entries: One of the sniper's main roles is to exert pressure on the enemy. The knowledge of a sniper's presence is enough to distract and make any opponent wary, afraid of being in their crosshair. When you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, your allies make melee attack rolls with advantage against that creature until the start of your next turn. If the attack misses, you can expend a Tactics die to still apply this effect. This effect is only active while you have line of sight with the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Customized Weapon
entries: You have a special bond with your weapon of choice, and have spent many hours customizing and improving it. Your Customized Weapon can be any bow or crossbow, and you can only have one Customized Weapon at any time. If you lose your special weapon for whatever reason, you can spend 1 hour working with a set of woodworker's tools to customize another weapon.

entries.name: Fast Bullet
entries: If you make an attack roll with your Customized Weapon and miss the target, you can roll one Tactics die and add the number rolled to the attack roll. If this causes the attack to hit, you expend the Tactics die.

entries.name: Heavy Bullet
entries: If you hit with an attack roll with your Customized Weapon, you can expend and roll one Tactics die and add the number rolled to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Sniping Techniques
entries: At 9th level, you gain the following features:

entries.name: Trivial Shot
entries: Training and experience are the true strength of a great marksman. You have learned to immediately recognize an easy shot, and never miss it.

When you make a ranged attack roll with a weapon with which you have proficiency, you can expend one Tactics die and decide to forgo rolling the d20 and instead get a 10 on the die. You expend the die only if the attack hits.

entries.name: Targeted Disruption
entries: You learn how to target your enemies at exactly the right spot to impede them. Before you make a ranged attack roll in which you have advantage, as a bonus action, you can roll one Tactics die and focus your shot on a specific target on your opponent's body. By doing so you can target either their legs or their weapon.

If the attack hits, after dealing the damage, you can take the Grapple action or the Disarm action. You use Dexterity as the ability for the check, and you can add the result of your Tactics die roll to the result. If the grapple or disarm succeeds, you expend the die.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Stealth
entries: You are incredibly proficient at hiding and moving between your hiding spots. As an action, you can magically become invisible, along with anything you are wearing or carrying, while you are at least behind half cover or lightly obscured.

This invisibility ends immediately after you deal damage to a creature or you force a creature to make a saving throw. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a Tactics die to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Shot
entries: You learn how to momentarily focus all your concentration on a single, lethal shot. When you make a ranged attack roll in which you have advantage, you can choose to automatically hit the target instead. If you do, you apply your sneak attack damage twice.
Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend three Tactics dice to use it again.
